page.title: 03HOUSING IN THE AREA
page.content: Addington Village has a long history going back to the tenth century.It still has many old houses and cottages remaining from the 15th century.Although most of it is new property.The majority of the houses in Addington Village are semi-detached and the average price of a house in the village is about Â£70000. As well as semi-detached houses there are also some flats, cottages and large houses in and around the village. These houses are expensive compared to the surrounding area. New Addington, on the other hand is fairly new, most of the houses being semi-detatched or terraced.The houses of New Addington are not as expensive because the majority of the estate is owned by the council. The average price of a semi-detached house in New Addington being Â£35000.
